page.title: 01Mid Wansbeck Valley
page.content: This part of the Wansbeck Valley is predominantly mixed farming. The average farm size is 300 acres feeding cattle and sheep and growing fodder and grain crops. Part of the area is covered by deciduous woods which provide shelter for houses, farm steadings and animals. Most people living in the area work in agriculture others commute to local towns or the city. Town meets country when school parties from local towns and Newcastle visit Marlish Farm. Bolam Hall has been developed into a number of houses creating a new community, Bolam church has an active congregation holding family services.
